When closing the workbench, I got the following error because I left the editor opened:

Problems occurred saving workbench.
  Unable to save perspective: Workspace - Debug.
    Unable to save editor: FindThis.java.
    java.lang.NullPointerException

When restarting with the same workspace, I got this error:
Unable to create this part due to an internal error. Reason for the failure: No input factory ID found for editor id=org.eclipse.jdt.ui.CompilationUnitEditor name=FindThis.java
  No input factory ID found for editor id=org.eclipse.jdt.ui.CompilationUnitEditor name=FindThis.java

In this case we store a java element handle memento in the breakpoint. When we re-create the java element, and ask for its corresponding editor input from the EditorUtility, it returns a resource file editor input to a file that does not exist.

Not sure if the EditorUtility/java element handles should take care of this, or if we have to work around the problem in the debugger, by storing a URI of the external file in the breakpoint marker.
The editor utility is internal and not made for such cases.
You should store the URI and use a FileStoreEditorInput and IDE.openEditorOnFileStore(...).
This is a regression from 3.2, as no error occurred in 3.2 for the same scenario (we did not attempt to open the external file in 3.2).
